title: Explicit route isn't intercepted

labels.name: Linking and Navigating
labels.description: Related to Next.js linking (e.g., <Link>) and navigation.

labels.name: Parallel & Intercepting Routes
labels.description: Related to Parallel and/or Intercepting routes.

body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/routing-issue-forked-yf9jdy?workspaceId=ws_99Vv8JQkByXmvk6vyjbsnP

### To Reproduce

1. Navigate to [codesandbox](https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/routing-issue-forked-yf9jdy?workspaceId=ws_99Vv8JQkByXmvk6vyjbsnP)
2. Click "Draft Page" link
3. Click "Add Row"
4. Note path "(...form)/[draftVer]/row" is displayed
5. Click "Create"
6. Note "Catch All" is displayed (Expected "(...form)/create")

### Current vs. Expected behavior

`(...form)/create` is not intercepting `form/create`

When clicking the "Create" link on the I expect the `form/create` route to be intercepted by the `(...form)/create` path, but it actually caught by the catch all route. 

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: linux
  Arch: x64
  Version: #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sun Aug  6 20:05:33 UTC 2023
  Available memory (MB): 4102
  Available CPU cores: 2
Binaries:
  Node: 20.12.0
  npm: 10.5.0
  Yarn: 1.22.19
  pnpm: 8.15.6
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.4.0-canary.93 // Latest available version is detected (15.4.0-canary.93).
  eslint-config-next: 15.2.0
  react: 19.0.0
  react-dom: 19.0.0
  typescript: 5.8.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Linking and Navigating, Parallel & Intercepting Routes

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local), next start (local)

### Additional context

_No response_
